file_content.text: Qualie sent word of the ancient ship. I congratulate you, friend, on doing what I could not.
Find Qualie at Pelath Point. Please. There may not be much time.
You've returned just in time. You did well, but the Gormak have outmaneuvered us. Outmaneuvered me.
I was focused on scattering their troops at the dam. So focused, that the Gormak managed to slip a small force past our scouts.
Are they planning another attack? Trying to escape?
What are the Gormak up to?
Then let's go after them!
You should have anticipated this!
Why weren't you more vigilant?
Aren't Jedi supposed to predict this kind of thing before it happens?
You dropped the ball, Master.
You think I don't see my own failure?
The Gormak were seen carrying excavation equipment. If the Evuk-Nosk isn't near the dam, then... then they must have found its true location.
Is my anger at the Gormak still blinding me? Did I overlook something, just for a chance to attack them?
Anger is the hardest emotion to control, and you had good reason to feel it.
We aren't perfect.
You acted as a Jedi should. Don't condemn yourself for not being perfect.
You ask too much of yourself.
And yet if others suffer for my failings.... No. I will make this right.
The Gormak got through. Why they got through isn't as important as stopping them.
Let's focus on fixing this.
Yes. A disciplined mind is a powerful weapon.
You say that like feelings can be stuck in a bottle, or plotted on a graph.
People are complicated.
Wisdom is found in the strangest places. Very well, let us make this right.
If the Gormak have found their relic, we don't have much time to waste.
I'm going after the Gormak.
You need to snap out of it.
You're right. I cannot compound my failure by dwelling on it.
The Gormak have taken up position near Pelath Point. It's one of the surviving research camps, a neutral Voss outpost. My Padawan, Qualie, is there.
I trust her to help you find this Evuk-Nosk. More than I trust myself at the moment. Please, go quickly.
We must scatter the Gormak forces from the dam before they find what they're looking for.
The expedition passed on their thanks for your help. And your education in Findsman "signs" has proved useful.
These discoveries complete a larger pattern. All these ruins explored or approached by the Gormak, belonged to the ancient Sith.
Even the ruins Padawan Kosh investigated were once besieged by them. Meaning, this Evuk-Nosk the Gormak seek must be a Sith relic.
Allowing the Gormak to possess such a thing would be disastrous; for them, and for us.
Then we must find it quickly.
Any relic would have to date from the time these ruins were built, perhaps as much as a thousand years.
It must be truly ancient.
Or longer. And we both know how many terrible things the ancient Sith created.
With respect, Master Halykus, I'm a soldier. Handling Sith relics is better left to Jedi.
This is beyond my training.
Think of it as keeping a dangerous device out of enemy hands. That's certainly your jurisdiction.
The more I find out about this Evuk-Nosk thing, the less I want to go running after it.
I'm not liking this.
Caution is often wise. But I must ask for your help again.
The only thing Gormak like more than abandoned technology, is abandoned technology that can kill.
Likely a Sith weapon, then.
Think what Gormak technicians could make from such a relic.
I'd call that a stretch.
I could show you the correlations between months of our survey data, and what the Findsman taught you, but time is short.
The main Gormak invasion force has been sighted. They've committed their forces to capturing a large Voss dam across the marches.
This whole region was once covered by flood waters, driving the Gormak out. Now I fear they've discovered the Evuk-Nosk near the dam.
Relic or not, if the Gormak have control of that dam, they can flood us out any time they want.
The dam itself is a risk.
I can stop them first.
Well, I've come this far....
Speak to our scout Beryl; he brought news of the dam's capture. Doctor Chull has also sent reports of Gormak stealing equipment.
More worryingly, another scout and a Voss commando were investigating Gormak movements. But only their astromech droid, T5-BD, has returned.
Those scouts must be found. The Gormak have caused enough suffering in this senseless rampage.
I'll see that the Gormak leave empty-handed.
I agree.
If I didn't know better, I'd say that Gormak attack left you with more than just a scar.
You really don't like Gormak.
Gormak are dangerous. Whatever my personal experience, ignoring that would be irresponsible.
Time for the Gormak to pay.
Do not be overcome by the need for battle. Do only what is necessary.
May the Force be with you. The Evuk-Nosk cannot fall into Gormak hands.
Wen and Padawan Kosh's investigations may lead us to this Evuk-Nosk. Not to mention the Findsman, if you can understand him.
Welcome, friends. Though I'm afraid we can't offer hospitality for so many.
Welcome. It's good to see another of the order, though we're in a poor state to greet you.
Welcome, friend. Though it's a poor welcome we can offer at the moment, I'm afraid.
We're facing a Gormak invasion. Their forces have destroyed every research camp between here and Pelath Point, and ransacked our equipment.
I've had my own clashes with the Gormak. But I've never seen them this relentless.
The lieutenant in Voss-Ka said you had a theory about why the Gormak are here.
What do the Gormak want?
The Force must have been with you, to survive such an attack.
That is quite a scar.
The Gormak really did a number on you.
That is quite a scar.
Since then, I've tried to study the Gormak only from a distance.
When the Gormak go on the offensive, they don't hold anything back.
Then you haven't been looking.
We discovered that, centuries past, this entire region was Gormak territory. I believed their return was no coincidence.
I sent scouts to eavesdrop on the Gormak patrols. The Gormak are looking for something, left behind long ago. They call it the "Evuk-Nosk."
Knowing the Gormak, I imagine this isn't just some harmless cultural artifact.
That can't be good.
Perhaps this is something the Voss have encountered, or heard stories of.
Do the Voss have any insights?
Our Voss friends had no idea; and "things of the Gormak" don't interest them.
I think I saw Evuk-Nosk do a set, at the Smiling Snivvian on Carratos--amazing vocals.
Sounds like a cantina band.
Not now, friend. Too many have died.
What is an Evuk-Nosk, and why is it worth bringing an army?
The "Evuk-Nosk"?
The meaning of the word has defeated our linguists.
That means nothing to me.
The Gormak spoke of the Evuk-Nosk as capable of scorching the sky, and turning Voss-Ka to rubble.
This Evuk-Nosk would present a terrible danger in Gormak hands. We must discover what it is, and where, before they do.
They have an entire army to search with, not to mention any clues they brought with them.
The Gormak have a head start.
But the Gormak have only recently returned. We've been working here for months.
Leave this to me.
You know this area best.
If the Evuk-Nosk is tied to this area's history, I would speak to the remaining members of the expedition.
Wen, a Jedi Knight, was looking for artifacts alongside the Voss. And Padawan Kosh--he and his Master were investigating a local Jedi ruin.
It sounds like we had a heavy investment in these excavations.
Was this a Jedi expedition?
The Jedi seem to have taken a large stake in these excavations.
Was this a Jedi expedition?
No, we were simply... better equipped to defend ourselves.
I'll see to it.
Hardly a challenge, but fine.
Oh, and a Gand Findsman came to the camp yesterday, offering his help against the Gormak.
He's rather... strange. But anything that helps us establish a pattern could be invaluable. Go safely.
These lands have so much potential. Perhaps once the Gormak are gone....
